Package game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
game.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
This represents a game of pokemon that changes turns between turn players. The game has players make moves to determine a winner
Author:
Rishi Zamvar and Kelsey Shan

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Game​(Pokemon p1, Pokemon p2)
    Constructs a game match with the given pokemon

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void changeTurn()
    This changes the turn from one pokemon to another

    This gets the move name of the pokemon

    This gets the first pokemon
    Pokemon getp2()
    This gets the second pokemon

    This gets the current turn

    This makes a move in the game

    This sets the second pokemon

    This determines if a pokemon has won the game

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(Pokemon p1, Pokemon p2)
      Constructs a game match with the given pokemon
      Parameters:
      p1 - the first Pokemon
      p2 - the second Pokemon

  • Method Details

    • setP1

      public void setP1​(Pokemon p)
      This sets the first pokemon
      Parameters:
      p - the Pokemon that will replace the current one

    • setP2

      public void setP2​(Pokemon p)
      This sets the second pokemon
      Parameters:
      p - the Pokemon that will replace the current one

    • move

      public void move​(int num)
      This makes a move in the game
      Parameters:
      num - the index of the move that will be performed

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName​(int pok, int num)
      This gets the move name of the pokemon
      Parameters:
      pok - The index of the pokemon that currently has the turn
      num - The index of the move name
      Returns:
      the name of the move selected

    • changeTurn

      public void changeTurn()
      This changes the turn from one pokemon to another

    • getp1

      public Pokemon getp1()
      This gets the first pokemon
      Returns:
      the first pokemon

    • getp2

      public Pokemon getp2()
      This gets the second pokemon
      Returns:
      the second pokemon

    • win

      public int win()
      This determines if a pokemon has won the game
      Returns:
      it returns 1 if the first pokemon wins, 2 if the second pokemon wins, and 0 if neither win

    • getTurn

      public int getTurn()
      This gets the current turn
      Returns:
      the pokemon who currently has the turn. It returns 1 for the first pokemon and 2 for the second pokemon.

    • setTurn

      public void setTurn​(int in)
      This sets which player currently has the turn
      Parameters:
      in - the player who will have the turn. 0 represents player 1 and 1 represents player 2.
